contentrichtext.text: {{Orphan|date=February 2009}} {{Quasar | name = [[Quasar|QSO]] B1522+546 | image = | epoch = [[J2000]] | ra = {{RA|15|24|05.6}}<ref name="ned">{{cite web | title=NASA/IPAC Extragalactic Database | work=Results for QSO B1522+546 | url=http://nedwww.ipac.caltech.edu/cgi-bin/nph-objsearch?objname=1522%2B546 | accessdate=2006-10-26 }}</ref> | dec = {{DEC|+54|28|18.4}}<ref name="ned" /> | constellation name = [[Draco (constellation)|Draco]] | z = 0.192<ref name="ned" /><ref name=SIMBAD/> | type =<ref name="ned" /> | dist_ly = 2.3 [[Giga-|billion]] [[light-year]]s<br/>([[Light travel time]])<ref name=ned/><br/>2.5 billion light-years<br/>([[Comoving distance|present]])<ref name=ned/> | appmag_v = 18.5<ref name="ned" /> | size_v = | notes = | names = [[List of astronomical catalogues#D|DA]] 383, [[Lyon-Meudon Extragalactic Database|LEDA]] 2817605, [[Third Cambridge Catalogue of Radio Sources|3C]] 319, [[Fourth Cambridge Survey|4C]] 54.34 }} ''QSO B1522+546'' is a [[Radio galaxy]]<ref name=SIMBAD>[http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/sim-id?protocol=html&Ident=QSO+B1522%2B546 SIMBAD]</ref> with a [[quasar]]-like appearance located in the [[constellation]] [[Draco (constellation)|Draco]]. ==References== <references /> ==External links== * [http://www.jb.man.ac.uk/atlas/object/3C319.html www.jb.man.ac.uk/atlas/] {{DEFAULTSORT:Qso B1522+546}} [[Category:Quasars|B1522+546]] {{galaxy-stub}}
